intro: Coffea nossikumbaensis, commonly known as the Nossikumba coffee. It is a species of flowering plant in the Rubiaceae family, native to the rainforests of western Africa. The plant produces small, red berries that contain the seeds used for coffee production. It is characterized by its glossy leaves and compact growth habit. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and potentially endangered species.
